document.title: What to Do Before Booking a Gold Coast Cleaner
document.author: kaung

body.raw:
Living in the sunny Gold Coast offers endless possibilities for adventure and relaxation. However, amidst the beachside bliss, keeping your home sparkling clean can often feel like a chore. Hiring a [professional cleaner in Gold Coast](https://coastmaid.com.au) is a fantastic way to reclaim your time and enjoy a fresh, stress-free environment. But before you dive into booking the first company you find, a little preparation can ensure you find the perfect cleaning fit for your needs.

1. Define Your Cleaning Needs:

Start by taking a realistic assessment of your cleaning requirements. Do you need a [regular weekly clean](https://coastmaid.com.au/regular-cleaning-gold-coast), a [deep clean](https://coastmaid.com.au/deep-cleaning-gold-coast) for a special occasion, or a specific service like [carpet cleaning](https://coastmaid.com.au/carpet-cleaning-gold-coast) or [bond cleaning](https://coastmaid.com.au/bond-cleaning-gold-coast)? Knowing your needs will help you choose a company offering the right services at the right price.

2. Research and Compare:

Don't settle for the first available cleaner. Get online recommendations from friends and family, search for reputable companies in your area, and compare their offerings. Look for companies with positive reviews, clear pricing structures, and a range of services to meet your needs.

3. Get Quotes:

Contact several cleaning companies, explain your specific requirements, and request quotes. Don't just focus on the price, but also consider factors like experience, insurance, cleaning methods, and availability.

4. Ask the Right Questions:

During the quote process, don't be afraid to ask questions. Clarify their cleaning process, inquire about the products they use, and discuss their experience with handling specific cleaning needs you may have.

5. Schedule a Meet-and-Greet (Optional):

If you're unsure about a company, consider a brief meet-and-greet. This allows you to personally assess their professionalism, ask any remaining questions, and establish clear communication for future services.

6. Communicate Clearly:

Once you've chosen a cleaner, clearly communicate your expectations about cleaning areas, specific needs, and desired level of detail. This ensures both parties are on the same page and avoids any misunderstandings.

7. Prepare Your Home (Optional):

While professional cleaners can handle most tasks, decluttering and tidying up your space beforehand can make their job easier and potentially shorten the cleaning time. Consider putting away valuables and fragile items, ensuring pets are secured, and making laundry baskets easily accessible.

By following these simple steps, you can approach booking a [Gold Coast cleaner](https://coastmaid.com.au) with confidence, knowing you've done your research and laid the groundwork for a smooth, successful cleaning experience. Now, go ahead and enjoy the sunshine, while your home receives the professional TLC it deserves!

document.title: The Gold Coast Glows: Why Professional Office Cleaning is Essential
document.author: kaung

body.raw:
## Investing in Professional Office Cleaning Services on the Gold Coast

The Gold Coast, renowned for its dazzling beaches and vibrant atmosphere, attracts businesses and entrepreneurs seeking a dynamic location to thrive. However, maintaining a thriving office environment extends beyond securing prime real estate. Cleanliness plays a crucial role in promoting employee well-being, productivity, and overall business success. Here's why investing in professional [office cleaning services](https://coastmaid.com.au/office-cleaning-gold-coast) in Gold Coast is essential:

1. **Enhanced Employee Health and Well-being:**

A clean and sanitized workplace directly impacts employee health. Dust, allergens, and germs accumulate quickly in busy offices, potentially leading to respiratory problems, allergies, and absenteeism. [Professional office cleaners](https://coastmaid.com.au/office-cleaning-gold-coast) utilize high-quality cleaning solutions and thorough methods to eliminate these concerns, fostering a healthier, more comfortable work environment for your team.

2. **Increased Productivity and Morale:**

A cluttered and dirty office can be demotivating and hinder employee focus. [Professional cleaners](https://coastmaid.com.au) ensure your workspace is organized and presentable, eliminating distractions and creating a pleasant ambiance. This translates to improved morale, increased concentration, and ultimately, enhanced work performance.

3. **A Positive First Impression:**

Your office serves as the first point of contact for clients and potential partners. A clean and professional environment creates a positive and lasting impression, fostering trust and confidence in your business. [Professional cleaning service](https://coastmaid.com.au) ensures your office consistently projects a polished and welcoming image, reflecting the professionalism of your organization.

4. **Extended Lifespan of Office Furniture and Equipment:**

Regular cleaning goes beyond aesthetics. Professional cleaners utilize proper techniques and products to maintain your office furniture and equipment, preventing dust build-up and wear and tear. This extends the lifespan of your valuable assets, saving you money on replacements in the long run.

5. **Peace of Mind and Time Management:**

Outsourcing cleaning frees up valuable time and resources for your team to focus on core business activities. Professional cleaners take care of the cleaning hassle, allowing you to focus on what matters most – running your business. Additionally, knowing your office receives thorough cleaning regularly offers peace of mind and ensures your workplace adheres to hygiene and safety standards.

Embrace the Gold Coast lifestyle without compromising on a clean and healthy work environment. Investing in [professional office cleaning services](https://coastmaid.com.au/office-cleaning-gold-coast) is a strategic decision that pays off in the long run, contributing to employee well-being, enhanced productivity, and the overall success of your Gold Coast business.

document.title: Why It's Time to Ditch the Dustpan and Embrace a Professional Cleaner
document.author: kaung

body.raw:
Let's be honest: life is busy. Between work, family, and social obligations, carving out time for chores like house cleaning can feel like an impossible feat. But what if there was a way to reclaim your precious hours and still maintain a sparkling clean home? Enter the [professional house cleaner](https://coastmaid.com.au), your personal hero in the fight against dust bunnies and grime.

Here are just a few reasons why hiring a cleaner might be the best decision you make all year:

1. **Reclaim Your Time and Sanity:**
   We all have 24 hours in a day, but how many of us truly feel like there's enough time for everything? Spending hours scrubbing floors and battling dust bunnies steals precious time you could be spending on things you actually enjoy. A professional cleaner frees up your schedule, allowing you to focus on what truly matters.

2. **Get a Deeper Clean Than You Can Do Yourself:**
   Let's face it, most of us have our cleaning shortcuts. But professional cleaners have the expertise and tools to tackle even the toughest grime and hidden dust bunnies. They'll leave your home not just clean, but truly sanitized and sparkling.

3. **Reduce Stress and Boost Your Mood:**
   Living in a cluttered, dirty environment can take a toll on your mental well-being. Coming home to a clean, organized space can instantly lift your mood and reduce stress levels. Imagine the peace of mind knowing your home is sparkling clean, even when you haven't touched a feather duster!

4. **Protect Your Health and Allergies:**
   Dust, allergens, and mold spores can wreak havoc on your health, especially for those with allergies or respiratory issues. Professional cleaners use effective cleaning methods and products that not only remove dirt but also eliminate these harmful allergens, creating a healthier environment for you and your family.

5. **Enjoy a More Relaxed Home Life:**
   Imagine hosting friends and family without the last-minute cleaning frenzy. A clean home isn't just about aesthetics; it's about creating a space where you can relax, unwind, and truly enjoy your time at home. With a professional cleaner on your side, you can finally do just that.

6. **It's More Affordable Than You Think:**
   Hiring a professional cleaner might seem like a luxury, but it's actually a budget-friendly way to improve your quality of life. Consider the cost of cleaning supplies, the time you'll save, and the potential wear and tear on your furniture from DIY cleaning mishaps. When you weigh the benefits, professional cleaning often pays for itself.

Ready to ditch the dustpan and embrace a cleaner, healthier, and happier home? Contact a reputable house cleaning service today and reclaim your time and sanity!

**Bonus Tip:** If you're a [house cleaning company](https://coastmaid.com.au), consider adding a call to action at the end of the article, inviting readers to contact you for a free quote or consultation. You can also personalize the article further by mentioning specific services you offer or highlighting any special promotions you have running.

document.title: Contact
document.description: Contact us for any questions or concerns about.

body.raw:
If you have any questions or concerns about Coast Maid, please contact us using one of the methods below. We will try to respond as soon as possible.

## Contact Information

-   **Email:** [contact@coastmaid.com.au](mailto:contact@coastmaid.com.au)

document.title: Privacy Policy
document.description: The Privacy Policy for Coast Maid.

body.raw:
Your privacy is very important to us. Accordingly, we have developed this Policy in order for you to understand how we collect, use, communicate, and disclose and make use of personal information. The following outlines our privacy policy.

1. **Purpose Identification:** Before or at the time of collecting personal information, we will identify the purposes for which information is being collected.

2. **Objective Collection and Use:** We will collect and use personal information solely with the objective of fulfilling those purposes specified by us and for other compatible purposes, unless we obtain the consent of the individual concerned or as required by law.

3. **Retention Period:** We will only retain personal information as long as necessary for the fulfillment of those purposes.

4. **Lawful and Fair Collection:** We will collect personal information by lawful and fair means and, where appropriate, with the knowledge or consent of the individual concerned.

5. **Relevance and Accuracy:** Personal data should be relevant to the purposes for which it is to be used, and, to the extent necessary for those purposes, should be accurate, complete, and up-to-date.

6. **Security Safeguards:** We will protect personal information by reasonable security safeguards against loss or theft, as well as unauthorized access, disclosure, copying, use, or modification.

7. **Information Accessibility:** We will make readily available to customers information about our policies and practices relating to the management of personal information.

We are committed to conducting our business in accordance with these principles to ensure that the confidentiality of personal information is protected and maintained.

body.raw:
Coast Maid Pty Ltd (“Coast Maid”) operates an online platform at [www.coastmaid.com.au](https://www.coastmaid.com.au) (the “Website”) through which customers (“Users”) can book a cleaner for the provision of cleaning services (“Cleaning Services”), by submitting a Booking Request. Coast Maid then matches the most suitable cleaner from its database of cleaners to the booking request.

This is a contract between Coast Maid and the users.

The cleaner is in the business of providing cleaning services.

Coast Maid enters into agreements with Users for and on behalf of cleaners for the provision of cleaning Services to users.

The user enters into two contractual relationships. The first contract being with Coast Maid, governing the access to and use of the website accordance with the terms and conditions of this agreement. The second contract being with Coast Maid as agent for the cleaner for the provision of the cleaning services (“Cleaning Agreement”).

The User is deemed to have entered into this Contract and a contractual relationship with Coast Maid through the making and acceptance of a Booking.

## AND THE PARTIES HEREBY AGREE:

Access to and use of the website is subject to the terms and conditions outlined in this agreement (the “Terms”).

### 1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION

#### 1.1. In these Terms (including the recitals), unless the context otherwise requires:

-   **Booking:** means the booking made by you on the Website for the provision of Cleaning Services;

-   **Booking System:** means the online system which enables you to make a Booking;

-   **Cleaning Fee:** means the fee, as advised by Coast Maid from time to time, (inclusive of goods and service tax, if applicable) for the Cleaning Services charged on an hourly basis or flat price and invoiced by Coast Maid;

-   **Intellectual Property Rights:** means all present and future rights anywhere in the world in relation to copyright, trademarks, designs, patents, or other proprietary rights, or any rights to registration of such rights whether existing before or after your access to the Website;

-   **Payment Amount:** means the amount that you are required to pay for the Cleaning Services under your Booking;

-   **Site Content:** means all material, content, and information made available on the Website including but not limited to written text, graphics, images, photographs, logos, trademarks, audio material, video material, and any other forms of expression;

-   **you, your:** means you as the user of the Website.

#### 1.2. In these Terms, unless the context otherwise requires:

(a) headings are for convenience only and do not affect its interpretation or construction;

(b) the singular includes the plural and vice versa;

(c) references to recitals, clauses, subclauses, paragraphs, annexures or schedules are references to recitals, clauses, subclauses, paragraphs, annexures, and schedules of or to these Terms;

(d) words importing a gender include other genders;

(e) the word “person” means a natural person and any association, body or entity whether incorporated or not;

(f) where any word or phrase is defined, any other part of speech or other grammatical forms of that word or phrase has a cognate meaning;

(g) a reference to any statute, proclamation, rule, code, regulation or ordinance includes any amendment, consolidation, modification, re-enactment or reprint of it or any statute, proclamation, rule, code, regulation or ordinance replacing it;

(h) all monetary amounts are in Australian currency;

(i) a reference to time refers to Eastern Standard Time;

(j) “includes” is not a word of limitation; no rule of construction applies to the disadvantage of a party because these Terms are prepared by (or on behalf of) that party;

(k) a reference to any thing is a reference to the whole and each part of it;

(l) a reference to a group of persons is a reference to all of them collectively and to each of them individually; and

(m) a reference to a document includes all amendments or supplements to, or replacements or novations of, that document.

### 2. TERMS AND CONDITIONS

#### 2.1. Access to and use of this Website is governed by these Terms.

#### 2.2. Coast Maid periodically reviews the Terms and reserves the right to change the Terms, without any notice to you, by updating this document. You should review this document, as available on the Website, regularly as any changes to the Terms take immediate effect from the date of the publication on this document. Your continued use of the Website after any such changes are made will be deemed to constitute your acceptance of those changes.

#### 2.3. You acknowledge that any hyperlinks or other redirection tools taking you to other operated by third parties that appear on the Website (“Third Party Sites”) are not controlled by Coast Maid and do not form part of the Website. You agree that you will not hold Coast Maid liable or in any way accountable for anything that occurs on any Third Party Site.

### 3. ACCEPTANCE

#### 3.1. In order to use this Website and make a Booking, you must first agree to the Terms.

#### 3.2. You accept the Terms by:

(A) creating a User Profile; and

(b) clicking to accept/agree to the Terms.

#### 3.3. Notwithstanding clause 3.2, you may not accept the Terms or access the Website if:

(a) you are not of legal age to form a binding contract with Coast Maid; or

(b) you are a person barred from entering into contracts under legislation,

In which case, you must immediately leave the Website.

#### 3.4. By accepting the Terms, you agree that this is clear and unequivocal proof that the Terms are not unconscionable, that there is no unfair bargaining power or position, that there is no duress, and that you have carefully read and understood the Terms.

#### 3.5. If you do not understand any part of the Terms you should seek independent legal advice.

### 4. USER PROFILE

#### 4.1. You will be required to register your personal information, including your name, address, phone number and payment details on the Website in order to make a Booking (“User Profile”).

#### 4.2. You will be issued with a username and password which are linked to your User Profile. The username and password are personal to you and are not transferable. You are responsible for all information posted on or transmitted via the Booking System by anyone using your username and password and any payments due for the Cleaning Services acquired through the Booking System by anyone using your username and password. You should notify us of any breach of security of your username and password immediately.

#### 4.3. You confirm that you are at least 18 years of age and possess the legal authority to use the Booking System in accordance with these Terms. You also agree that all information supplied by you in using the Website and the Booking System will be true and accurate at all times.

#### 4.4. Coast Maid may delete or block User Profiles at its own discretion. Blocked users are prohibited from setting up a new User Profile.

### 5. BOOKING SYSTEM

#### 5.1. To make a Booking you must login to your User Profile and use the Booking System to request

a Booking. There is a minimum two (2) hour duration for hourly bookings and a minimum of one bedroom for flat priced bookings. You will receive a Booking confirmation receipt from Coast Maid after submitting your Booking request.

#### 5.2. Coast Maid will then make your contact details, location, requested time and the scope of the Cleaning Service available to their Cleaner network. An available Cleaner will then confirm their acceptance of the Booking.

#### 5.3. You are able to request a preferred Cleaner. Coast Maid will take your preference into account when facilitating the Cleaning Service, however a specific Cleaner cannot be guaranteed and will depend on the Cleaner’s availability.

#### 5.4. When a Booking is confirmed by a Cleaner, Coast Maid will issue you with an acceptance email and attach the Cleaning Agreement that constitutes the relationship between you and the Cleaner for the provision of the Cleaning services. Coast Maid will not, in anyway, be involved in the Cleaning Agreement between you and the Cleaner, aside from processing the Payment Amount on behalf of the Cleaner and providing you with an invoice in accordance with clause 6.4.

#### 5.5. If the requested Cleaner cannot fulfill your Booking, Coast Maid will arrange an alternative Cleaner for the requested Booking time.

#### 5.6. If the requested Booking cannot be facilitated, Coast Maid will arrange an alternative time for the Cleaning Service with you and a Cleaner.

#### 5.7. You are not permitted to engage the Cleaning Services of a Cleaner other than through the Booking System on the Website.

#### 5.8. The Booking System is provided on the Website to enable you to make legitimate Bookings and to make payments for those Bookings, and for no other purposes.

#### 5.9. Any speculative, false or fraudulent Booking is prohibited. You agree that the Booking System will only be used to make legitimate Bookings for you or another person for whom you are legally authorised to act. You acknowledge that abuse of the Booking System may result in you being denied access to the Booking System.

#### 5.10. Coast Maid has the right at any time to add, change or withdraw functions available on the Website at its own discretion.

### 6. PAYMENT

#### 6.1. You agree that at the time of the first Booking, your payment details will be transferred to Coast Maid’s secure payment gateway. Upon the successful Booking, Coast Maid will take payment for the Booking. You must ensure that sufficient funds are available for debit at that time. Fees and charges relating to insufficient funds at time of debit will be passed onto you.

#### 6.2. If you making a recurring Booking, your payment details will be transferred to Coast Maid’s secure payment gateway 48 hours prior to the scheduled Cleaning Services in the recurring booking, Coast Maid will take payment for the Cleaning Services. You must ensure that sufficient funds are available for debit at that time. Fees and charges relating to insufficient funds at time of debit will be passed onto you.

#### 6.3. On receipt of the Cleaning Fee, Coast Maid will hold the Cleaning Fee on behalf of the Cleaner until such time as it accounts to the Cleaner, pays a refund to you (if you are entitled to a refund) or credits payment of our fees and charges. No interest will be payable by Coast Maid to you or the Cleaner on amounts held by Coast Maid.

#### 6.4. Coast Maid, on behalf and in the name of the Cleaner, will issue you with a tax invoice.

#### 6.5. Late Payments, If for any reason your payment does not go through by 7 days of the service being completed, you will be sent a PayPal invoice to be paid within 10 days, If you don’t pay the account with 10 days you agree to pay a late fee of $20 per day. If your account is still not paid after 14 days, it will be sent to collections. By using the services of Coast Maid, you agree to pay a compounded late fee as well as any fees associated with collection of the debt.

### 7. CHANGES AND CANCELLATIONS

#### 7.1. You can cancel or amend a Booking free of charge, up to 24 hours before the Cleaning Service is scheduled to begin.

#### 7.2. If you cancel or amend a Booking within 24 hours before the Cleaning Service is scheduled to begin, you will have to pay cancellation costs equivalent to one hour of the Cleaning Fee.

#### 7.3. You cannot amend, extend or cancel a Booking during the performance of the Services.

#### 7.4. The Cleaning Agreement shall expire once the Cleaning Services under the Booking have been performed.

#### 7.5. If the Cleaner is unable to fulfill a confirmed Booking (in full or part), Coast Maid will attempt to find you a replacement Cleaner. If we cannot find you an alternative Cleaner, we will reschedule your Booking to a new time which suits you. If we cannot find a suitable time for you, you may cancel the Booking at no charge.

### 8. CLEANING SERVICES

#### 8.1. Coast Maid operates the Website as a third party facilitator for the Cleaning Services and provides you with the platform to purchase the Cleaning Services.

#### 8.2. Coast Maid is not an agent or broker for you. You enter into any transaction with Coast Maid on behalf of a Cleaner entirely at your own risk.

#### 8.3. Coast Maid uses their best efforts to monitor the Cleaning Services offered by a Cleaner. However, Coast Maid does not make any representation as to the safety, quality, condition or description of any products used or Cleaning Services provided by Cleaner. Any issues regarding safety, quality, condition or description should be notified to Coast Maid, who will then pass the issue onto the Cleaner designated to your Booking. You should refer to the terms and conditions of your Cleaning Agreement for further information.

#### 8.4. All bookings are subject to Cleaner availability.

### 9. TERMINATION

#### 9.1. Coast Maid may at its discretion terminate your use of, or access to, the Website at any time. If this happens, we may notify you by email. If your use of the Website is terminated:

(a) you are no longer authorised to access the Website or use any other Coast Maid services with the email address you used to register with the Website or any other email address you possess;

(b) you will continue to be subject to and bound by all restrictions imposed on you by the Terms; and

(c) all licences granted by you and all disclaimers by Coast Maid and limitations of Coast Maid’s liability set out in the Terms or elsewhere on the Website will survive termination.

#### 9.2. You may terminate this agreement by emailing Coast Maid at [contact@moreclean.com.au](mailto:hello@moreclean.com.au). Coast Maid will disable your User Profile within fourteen (14) days of receipt of the email requesting termination of your User Profile.

#### 9.3. Coast Maid reserves the right to deduct any outstanding fees and charges owing to Coast Maid and/or the Cleaner on your User Profile prior to disabling it.

## 10. DISPUTE RESOLUTION POLICY

### 10.1. Mediation

Coast Maid will use reasonable endeavours to mediate any dispute concerning the use of the Website.

### 10.2. Cleaning Services Disputes

Disputes related to the Cleaning Services or any other issue will be referred, where appropriate, to external dispute resolution services or authorities.

## 11. SECURITY OF PAYMENT

### 11.1. Information Protection

We have taken all practical steps to ensure the protection of your information. A secure payment gateway is used for all transactions. Coast Maid does not provide a warranty regarding the secure payment gateway's strength or effectiveness and is not responsible for events arising from unauthorized access to your information.

## 12. PRIVACY

### 12.1. Personal Information

In this clause, Personal Information means information or an opinion about an individual.

### 12.2. Collection and Storage

Coast Maid collects and stores Personal Information in accordance with our Privacy Policy available on the website [www.moreclean.com.au/privacy](www.moreclean.com.au/privacy).

### 12.3. Disclosure

You agree that Coast Maid will disclose your Personal Information to the Cleaner for the provision of Cleaning Services.

### 12.4. Privacy Principles

Both parties must abide by all relevant Australian Privacy Principles in their collection, use, disclosure, and storage of Personal Information.

## 13. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

### 13.1. Protection of Site Content

The Site Content is protected by copyright, and Coast Maid reserves all Intellectual Property Rights.

### 13.2. License

By accepting the Terms, you are granted a non-exclusive license to view the Website, print pages, and download material for caching purposes only.

### 13.3. Restrictions

You must not copy, republish, redistribute, sell, or edit Site Content without Coast Maid's prior written consent.

## 14. ACCEPTABLE USE

### 14.1. Prohibited Use

You must not use the Website in any way that breaches these Terms, infringes Intellectual Property Rights, is fraudulent, illegal, or causes impairment of Website accessibility.

### 14.2. Malicious Software

You must not use the Website to store, host, transmit, or distribute malicious computer software.

## 15. INDEMNITY AND LIABILITY

### 15.1. General Indemnity

You agree to indemnify Coast Maid for any claim, damage, loss, or expense resulting from your actions in breach of these Terms.

### 15.2. Limitation of Liability

Coast Maid will not be liable for direct, indirect, or consequential loss in relation to Site Content or Website use.

### 15.3. Cleaning Services Liability

To the extent permitted by law, Coast Maid is not liable for any loss or damage related to the offer or supply of Cleaning Services.

### 15.4. Information Accuracy

Coast Maid does not accept liability for the accuracy of information provided by other users. Site Content is for general information only.

### 15.5. Acceptance

By using the Website, you accept the indemnity and limitations of liability in this clause.

## 16. WARRANTIES AND REPRESENTATIONS

### 16.1. Use at Own Risk

The use of the Website is at your own risk. Site Content is provided on an "as is" and "as available" basis without warranty.

### 16.2. No Representations

Coast Maid and its affiliates make no express or implied representation or warranty about the Site Content or Website.

## 17. GENERAL PROVISIONS

### 17.1. Jurisdiction

Prohibited provisions are ineffective in the relevant jurisdiction.

### 17.2. Void or Unenforceable

Void, illegal, or unenforceable provisions do not affect the validity of other provisions.

### 17.3. Severability

If a clause is void, illegal, or unenforceable, it may be severed without affecting other provisions.

### 17.4. Governing Law

These Terms are governed by the law applicable to New South Wales, and you submit to the jurisdiction of the Courts of New South Wales.

## 18. Unpaid Services

### 18.1. Payment Terms

Payment for invoices is required within 10 days. Non-compliance results in added fees and daily late charges. Outstanding accounts may incur additional costs related to debt collection.

## 19. End-of-Lease Services

### Booking Terms

When booking End-of-Lease services, customers must choose the appropriate option. Incorrect bookings may result in additional charges. Customers declining additional costs grant authority to cancel the service with a non-refundable fee.
